revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Artist Discography |Artist = [[The Byrds]] |Logo = |Image = |Caption = |Studio = 12 |Live = 3 |Singles = 29 |Video = |Music videos= |EP = 6 |Compilation = 43 |Soundtrack = }} [[The Byrds]] were an American [[Rock music|rock]] [[Musical ensemble|band]] that were formed in Los Angeles, California in 1964.{{cite web|title=The Byrds Biography|publisher=[[Allmusic]]|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p3810|pure_url=yes}}|accessdate=2010-01-30}} Although the band only enjoyed the huge commercial success of contemporaries like [[The Beatles]] or [[The Beach Boys]] for a short period of time (1965â1966), they were pivotal in originating the musical styles of [[folk rock]], [[psychedelic rock]], [[raga rock]], and [[country rock]].{{cite web|title=Psychedelic Rock Overview|publisher=[[Allmusic]]|url={{Allmusic|class=explore|id=style/d380|pure_url=yes}}|accessdate=2010-01-30}}{{cite book|author=Bellman, Jonathan.|page=351|year=1997|title=The Exotic In Western Music|publisher=Northeastern Publishing|isbn=1-555-53319-1}} The band underwent several line-up changes throughout its existence, with frontman [[Roger McGuinn]] remaining the sole consistent member of the group until their disbandment in 1973.{{cite web|title=Roger McGuinn Biography|publisher=[[Allmusic]]|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p104158|pure_url=yes}}|accessdate=2010-01-30}} The Byrds' discography was originally released on the [[Gramophone record|vinyl]] format, as full-length [[LP album|LPs]], shorter [[Extended play|EPs]], and [[Single (music)|singles]].{{cite book|author=Rogan, Johnny.|pages=541â554|year=1998|title=The Byrds: Timeless Flight Revisited|edition=2nd|publisher=Rogan House|isbn=0-95295-401-X}} Since the 1960s, the band's back catalogue has also been released on [[Reel-to-reel audio tape recording|reel-to-reel tape]], [[Compact Cassette|audio cassette]], [[8-track tape]], [[Compact Disc|CD]], [[MiniDisc]], and, most recently, as [[Music download|digital downloads]]. Between 1965 and 1969, The Byrds' albums were released in both [[Monaural|mono]] and [[Stereophonic sound|stereo]] variations, with ''[[Ballad of Easy Rider (album)|Ballad of Easy Rider]]'' being the first album to be released exclusively in stereo. The bulk of the band's releases were issued on [[Columbia Records]] or its subsidiaries, with a notable exception being their final studio album from 1973. This final album, titled ''[[Byrds (album)|Byrds]]'', and its accompanying singles ("[[Full Circle Song|Full Circle]]", "Things Will Be Better", and "[[Cowgirl in the Sand]]") were all released on [[Asylum Records]]. In addition, the band released a single under the pseudonym of The Beefeaters in October 1964 on [[Elektra Records]] ([[Pye Records]] in the UK), before they had signed a [[recording contract]] with Columbia. The Byrds' albums began to appear on [[compact disc]] sporadically during the late 1980s and early 1990s, both on Columbia and on re-issue labels like [[Demon Music Group|Edsel]] and [[BGO Records|BGO]].{{cite book|author=Rogan, Johnny.|page=665|year=1998|title=The Byrds: Timeless Flight Revisited|edition=2nd|publisher=Rogan House|isbn=0-95295-401-X}} Starting in 1996, all eleven of the band's Columbia studio albums were reissued on [[Legacy Recordings|Columbia/Legacy]] in [[remaster]]ed editions with [[bonus track]]s.{{cite web|title=The Byrds' Remastered Albums 1996 - 2000|publisher=Byrds Flyght|url=http://users.skynet.be/byrdsfollower/remasters1996-2000.htm|accessdate=2010-01-30}} This article lists all of the band's U.S. and UK [[studio album]]s, [[live album]]s, official [[Compilation album|compilations]], EPs, and singles. Releases originating from or exclusive to other international territories are not included. ==Studio albums== {|class="wikitable" |- !rowspan="2"| Date !rowspan="2"| Title !colspan="2"| Chart positions |- !style="width:4em"| U.S. !style="width:4em"| UK |- | June 21, 1965 | ''[[Mr. Tambourine Man (album)|Mr. Tambourine Man]]'' |align="center"| 6 |align="center"| 7 |- | December 6, 1965 | ''[[Turn! February 1969]]'' |align="center"| â |align="center"| â |- | June 17, 2008 | ''[[Live at Royal Albert Hall 1971]]'' |align="center"| â |align="center"| â |- |align="center" colspan="25" style="font-size: 8pt"| "—" denotes release did not chart or become certified. |} == Compilations == There have been many [[compilation album]]s by The Byrds released since 1967, with the majority of these collections consisting of material recorded between 1965 and 1971, a period when the band were with [[Columbia Records]]. In addition, three [[Compilation album|compilations]] of material recorded before the group secured a [[recording contract]] with Columbia have been released under the titles ''[[Preflyte]]'', ''[[In the Beginning (The Byrds album)|In the Beginning]]'', and ''[[Preflyte|The Preflyte Sessions]]''. Two compilations of rare and previously unissued material have also been released as ''[[Never Before (album)|Never Before]]'' and ''Another Dimension''. There have so far been two Byrds' [[box set]]s issued: ''[[The Byrds (boxed set)|The Byrds]]'' (October 1990) and the more recent ''[[There Is a Season]]'' (September 2006). Also, excerpts of the band's performance at the [[Monterey Pop Festival]] have been released on ''The Monterey International Pop Festival'' CD box set and among the extras on the ''[[Monterey Pop]]'' DVD. *NOTE: The four [[compilation album]]s with the title ''The Very Best of The Byrds'' (released in 1983, 1997, 2006, and 2008) are not the same and each features a different track listing. *NOTE: The three compilations titled ''The Byrds Play Dylan'' or ''The Byrds Play the Songs of Bob Dylan'' (released in 1979, 2001, and 2002) are not the same and each features a different track listing. {|class="wikitable" |- !rowspan="2"| Date !rowspan="2"| Title !colspan="2"| Chart positions |- !style="width:4em"| U.S. !style="width:4em"| UK |- | August 7, 1967 | ''[[The Byrds' Greatest Hits]]'' |align="center"| 6 |align="center"| â |- | July 29, 1969 | ''[[Preflyte]]'' |align="center"| 84 |align="center"| â |- | October 29, 1971 | ''[[The Byrds' Greatest Hits Volume II]]'' # |align="center"| â |align="center"| â |- | January 25, 2010 | ''Eight Miles High: The Best of The Byrds'' # |align="center"| â |align="center"| â |- |align="center" colspan="25" style="font-size: 8pt"| "—" denotes release did not chart or become certified. |- |align="center" colspan="25" style="font-size: 8pt"| "#" denotes non-U.S. release. |} ==Extended plays== [[Columbia Records|CBS Records]] released two Byrds [[Extended play|EPs]] in the UK during 1966, featuring tracks taken from the band's first three albums. Then, in 1971, Columbia Records and [[Scholastic Corporation|Scholastic Books]] released an EP in the United States to tie-in with the publication of Bud Scoppa's biography of The Byrds. A further three EPs were released in the UK between 1983 and 1990 on various [[record label]]s. {|class="wikitable" |- !rowspan="2"| Date !rowspan="2"| Title !colspan="2"| Chart positions |- !style="width:4em"| U.S. !style="width:4em"| UK |- | February 1966 | ''The Times They Are a-Changin''' |align="center"| â |align="center"| â |- | October 1966 | ''Eight Miles High'' |align="center"| â |align="center"| â |- | 1971 | ''The Byrds'' |align="center"| â |align="center"| â |- | September 1983 | ''The Byrds'' |align="center"| â |align="center"| â |- | May 1989 | ''Solid Gold'' |align="center"| â |align="center"| â |- | December 1990 | ''Four Dimensions'' |align="center"| â |align="center"| â |- |align="center" colspan="25" style="font-size: 8pt"| "—" denotes release did not chart or become certified. |} ==Singles== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |+Highest position reached in UK and U.S. singles charts |- ! rowspan="2"| Date ! rowspan="2"| Title ! colspan="2"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2"| Album |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="width:4em"| [[Billboard Hot 100|U.S.]] ! width="width:4em"| [[UK Singles Chart|UK]] |- | October 7, 1964 | align="left"| "Please Let Me Love You" /

;Notes *A [[#ref_A|'''^''']] Released under the pseudonym The Beefeaters. *B [[#ref_B|'''^''']] UK only re-release of The Byrds' fourth Columbia single with its [[A-side and B-side]] inverted. *C [[#ref_C|'''^''']] "Have You Seen Her Face" was not released as a single in the UK. *D [[#ref_D|'''^''']] UK release of "Lady Friend" with alternate B-side. *E [[#ref_E|'''^''']] UK only release. *F [[#ref_F|'''^''']] "Ballad of Easy Rider" was not released as a single in the UK. *G [[#ref_G|'''^''']] "I Trust (Everything Is Gonna Work Out Alright)" was not released as a single in the U.S. *H [[#ref_H|'''^''']] "Things Will Be Better" was not released as a single in the U.S. *I [[#ref_I|'''^''']] U.S. only release. *J [[#ref_J|'''^''']] UK only re-release.
